Bridge class and Openseesmodel class¶

class Bridgemodel.Bridge(Nodedata, ConnectivityData, beamtype, MemberData, membtrans)¶

Bases: object

Class containing bridge informations from Bridge Pickle file for use in Openseespy framework

Class constructor - collecting the dataframes for bridge properties

class Bridgemodel.OpenseesModel(Nodedata, ConnectivityData, beamtype, MemberData, memtrans)¶

Bases: Bridgemodel.Bridge

Class to create bridge model in Openseespy framework based on input of Bridge model class

Class constructor - collecting the dataframes for bridge properties

create_Opensees_model()¶

Code handling the generation of bridge model in Openseespy framework :return:

generatemodel(ndm, ndf)¶

Code handling the start of bridge model generation - Opensees model space properties :param ndm: model dimension [Default 3 ] :param ndf: degree-of-freedoms for each model nodes [Default 6]

createnodes()¶

Code handling generation of nodes in Openseespy. Nodes specified in attribute of Bridge class :return:

boundaryconditions()¶

Code handling generation of boundary conditions in Openseespy. Boundary conditions specified in attribute of Bridge class. :return:

static get_fixity(fixity_code)¶

Static method to translate fixity code to communicate with Openseespy’s boundary definition :param fixity_code: list of string containing fixity symbol F for Free, R for restrained :return: boundary: list of 1 and 0 for fixity information 1 = fix, 0 = free

concrete_materialprop()¶

Code handling the creation of material tags in Openseespy. Default concrete = 1

ele_transform(transfType='Linear')¶
Code handling the definition of geometric transformation of members. Transformation

specified in attribute of Bridge class.

Returns

Note

This function needs the implementation of active skew modelling - consideration of orthorgonal element transform for highly skewed (>50deg) grillages.

assemble_element()¶

Code specifying generation of grillage elements. :return:

get_sectioninput(member)¶

Function to obtain member attribute from Bridge class attribute. :param member: int/str, section tag :return: section input for member section matching section tag

classmethod time_series(defSeries='Constant')¶

Code handling the time series generation for Openseespy. Default “Constant”, tag 1 :return:

classmethod loadpattern(pat='Plain')¶

Code handling the pattern load case for Openseespy. Default “Plain”, tag 1, load factor 1 :return:

search_nodes()¶

Function to search grillage element emcompassing load position by :return:

load_position(pos, axlwt)¶

Code handling the load definition for Openseespy. :param pos: :param axlwt: :return:

static hermite_shape_function(zeta, a)¶
Parameters

  • zeta – absolute position in x direction

  • a – absolute position in x direction

Returns

Four terms [N1, N2, N3, N4] of hermite shape function

Note

Further validation needed - trial on different bridge models

static linear_shape_function(zeta, eta)¶
Parameters

  • zeta – absolute position in x direction

  • eta – absolute position in z direction

Returns

Four terms [N1, N2, N3, N4] of Linear shape function

Note

Further validation needed - trial on different bridge models

load_movingtruck(truck_pos, axlwts, axlspc, axlwidth)¶

Code handling moving truck simulation. This method loops for each position in the Vehicle class This function handles the subfunctions - searchnodes() - load_positions() - :param truck_pos: Truck position [x,z] :param axlwts: list , axle weights :param axlspc: :param axlwidth: :return:

Example: Call structure¶

with open("save.p","rb") as f:
    refbridge = pickle.load(f)
